org.apache.freemarker.core

Interface TopLevelConfiguration

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ParsingAndProcessingConfiguration, ParsingConfiguration, ProcessingConfiguration
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Configuration, Configuration.Builder, Configuration.ExtendableBuilder

    public interface TopLevelConfiguration
extends ParsingAndProcessingConfiguration
    Implemented by FreeMarker core classes (not by you) that provide Configuration-level settings. New methods may be added any time in future FreeMarker versions, so don't try to implement this interface yourself!
    See Also:
    ParsingAndProcessingConfiguration

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface org.apache.freemarker.core.ProcessingConfiguration

        MISSING_VALUE_MARKER

    • Method Detail

      • getTemplateResolver

        TemplateResolver getTemplateResolver()
        The TemplateResolver to use; defaults to a DefaultTemplateResolver.

      • isTemplateResolverSet

        boolean isTemplateResolverSet()
        Tells if this setting was explicitly set (otherwise its value will be the default value).

      • getTemplateLoader

        TemplateLoader getTemplateLoader()
        The TemplateLoader that is used to look up and load templates; defaults to null. By providing your own TemplateLoader implementation, you can load templates from whatever kind of storages, like from relational databases, NoSQL-storages, etc.

        You can chain several TemplateLoader-s together with MultiTemplateLoader.

        If the the templateResolver is a DefaultTemplateResolver then this setting is allowed to be null (however then you won't be able to load any templates). If the class of the templateResolver is something else that doesn't support this setting, then it must be null. These checks are postponed until the Configuration instance is created.

      • isTemplateLoaderSet

        boolean isTemplateLoaderSet()
        Tells if this setting was explicitly set (otherwise its value will be the default value).

      • getTemplateLookupStrategy

        TemplateLookupStrategy getTemplateLookupStrategy()
        The TemplateLookupStrategy that is used to look up templates based on the requested name, locale and custom lookup condition. Its default is DefaultTemplateLookupStrategy.INSTANCE, except when the templateResolver doesn't support this setting, in which case it's null.

        If the the templateResolver is a DefaultTemplateResolver then this setting must not be null. If the class of the templateResolver is something else that doesn't support this setting, then it must be null. These checks are postponed until the Configuration instance is created.

      • isTemplateLookupStrategySet

        boolean isTemplateLookupStrategySet()
        Tells if this setting was explicitly set (otherwise its value will be the default value).

      • getTemplateNameFormat

        TemplateNameFormat getTemplateNameFormat()
        The template name format used; see TemplateNameFormat. The default is DefaultTemplateNameFormatFM2.INSTANCE (while the recommended value for new projects is DefaultTemplateNameFormat.INSTANCE), except when the templateResolver doesn't support this setting, in which case it's null.

        If the the templateResolver is a DefaultTemplateResolver then this setting must not be null. If the class of the templateResolver is something else that doesn't support this setting, then it must be null. These checks are postponed until the Configuration instance is created.

      • isTemplateNameFormatSet

        boolean isTemplateNameFormatSet()
        Tells if this setting was explicitly set (otherwise its value will be the default value).

      • getTemplateConfigurations

        TemplateConfigurationFactory getTemplateConfigurations()
        The TemplateConfigurationFactory that will configure individual templates where their settings differ from those coming from the common Configuration object. Defaults to null. A typical use case for that is specifying the outputFormat or sourceEncoding for templates based on their file extension or parent directory.

        Note that the settings suggested by standard file extensions are stronger than that you set here. See ParsingConfiguration.getRecognizeStandardFileExtensions() for more information about standard file extensions.

        See "Template configurations" in the FreeMarker Manual for examples.

        If the the templateResolver is a DefaultTemplateResolver then this is allowed to be null. If the class of the templateResolver is something else that doesn't support this setting, then it must be null. These checks are postponed until the Configuration instance is created.

      • isTemplateConfigurationsSet

        boolean isTemplateConfigurationsSet()
        Tells if this setting was explicitly set (otherwise its value will be the default value).

      • getTemplateCacheStorage

        CacheStorage getTemplateCacheStorage()
        The map-like object used for caching templates to avoid repeated loading and parsing of the template "files" to Template objects. The default is a SoftCacheStorage, except when the templateResolver doesn't support this setting, in which case it's null.

        If the the templateResolver is a DefaultTemplateResolver then this setting must not be null. If the class of the templateResolver is something else that doesn't support this setting, then it must be null. These checks are postponed until the Configuration instance is created.

      • isTemplateCacheStorageSet

        boolean isTemplateCacheStorageSet()
        Tells if this setting was explicitly set (otherwise its value will be the default value).

      • getTemplateUpdateDelayMilliseconds

        Long getTemplateUpdateDelayMilliseconds()
        The time in milliseconds that must elapse before checking whether there is a newer version of a template "file" than the cached one. The defaults is 5000 ms, except when the templateResolver doesn't support this setting, in which case it's null.

        If the the templateResolver is a DefaultTemplateResolver then this setting must not be null. If the class of the templateResolver is something else that doesn't support this setting, then it must be null. These checks are postponed until the Configuration instance is created.

      • isTemplateUpdateDelayMillisecondsSet

        boolean isTemplateUpdateDelayMillisecondsSet()
        Tells if this setting was explicitly set (otherwise its value will be the default value).

      • getIncompatibleImprovements

        Version getIncompatibleImprovements()
        Returns the value of the "incompatible improvements" setting; this is the FreeMarker version number where the not 100% backward compatible bug fixes and improvements that you want to enable were already implemented. In new projects you should set this to the FreeMarker version that you are actually using. In older projects it's also usually better to keep this high, however you better check the changes activated (find them below), at least if not only the 3rd version number (the micro version) of incompatibleImprovements is increased. Generally, as far as you only increase the last version number of this setting, the changes are always low risk.

        Bugfixes and improvements that are fully backward compatible, also those that are important security fixes, are enabled regardless of the incompatible improvements setting.

        An important consequence of setting this setting is that now your application will check if the stated minimum FreeMarker version requirement is met. Like if you set this setting to 3.0.1, but accidentally the application is deployed with FreeMarker 3.0.0, then FreeMarker will fail, telling that a higher version is required. After all, the fixes/improvements you have requested aren't available on a lower version.

        Note that as FreeMarker's minor (2nd) or major (1st) version number increments, it's possible that emulating some of the old bugs will become unsupported, that is, even if you set this setting to a low value, it silently wont bring back the old behavior anymore. Information about that will be present here.

        Currently the effects of this setting are:

        • 3.0.0: This is the lowest supported value in FreeMarker 3.

        Specified by:
        getIncompatibleImprovements in interface ParsingConfiguration
        Returns:
        Never null.

      • getLocalizedTemplateLookup

        Boolean getLocalizedTemplateLookup()
        Whether localized template lookup is enabled. The default is true, except when the templateResolver doesn't support this setting, in which case it's null.

        With the default TemplateLookupStrategy, localized template lookup works like this: Let's say your locale setting is Locale("en", "AU"), and you call cfg.getTemplate("foo.ftl"). Then FreeMarker will look for the template under these names, stopping at the first that exists: "foo_en_AU.ftl", "foo_en.ftl", "foo.ftl". See the description of the default value at getTemplateLookupStrategy() for a more details. If you need to generate different template names, set your own a TemplateLookupStrategy implementation as the value of the templateLookupStrategy setting.

        If the templateResolver doesn't support this setting, then it must be null. These checks are postponed until the Configuration instance is created.

      • isLocalizedTemplateLookupSet

        boolean isLocalizedTemplateLookupSet()
        Tells if this setting was explicitly set (otherwise its value will be the default value).

      • getSharedVariables

        Map<String,Object> getSharedVariables()
        Shared variables are variables that are visible as top-level variables for all templates, except where the data model contains a variable with the same name (which then shadows the shared variable). This setting value store the variables as they were originally added, that is, without being wrapped into TemplateModel interface (unless the original value was already a TemplateModel). The wrapped values can be accessed with Configuration.getWrappedSharedVariable(String).
        Returns:
        Not null; immutable Map.
        See Also:
        Configuration.ExtendableBuilder.setSharedVariables(Map)

      • isSharedVariablesSet

        boolean isSharedVariablesSet()
        Tells if this setting was explicitly set (if not, the default value of the setting will be used).
